required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Nasal Glucagon in Participants With a Common Cold
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1 Study to Evaluate the Effects of Common Cold and of Concomitant Administration of Nasal Decongestant on the Pharmacokinetics and Pharmacodynamics of a Novel Glucagon Formulation in Otherwise Healthy Subjects

brief_summary.textblock: The main purpose of this study is to evaluate the safety of nasal glucagon (NG) in participants with a common cold, some of whom will also take a nasal decongestant. The study will investigate how the body processes NG and the effect of NG on the body. The study will last up to 30 days for each participant.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With One or More Serious Adverse Event(s) (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: Safety and tolerability evaluated through the assessment of adverse events. A SAE (serious adverse event) was defined as any untoward medical occurrence in a clinical investigation participant administered the investigational product and which did not necessarily have a causal relationship with this treatment. A summary of other non-serious AEs, and all SAE's, regardless of causality, is located in the Reported Adverse Events section.

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacokinetics (PK): Area Under the Concentration Versus Time Curve From Time Zero to T (AUC[0-tlast]) of Baseline Adjusted Glucagon
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose; 0.08, 0.17, 0.25, 0.33, 0.5, 0.67, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5 and 3.0 hours after glucagon administration

secondary_outcome.measure: PK: Area Under the Curve Extrapolated to Infinity (AUC[0-inf]) of Baseline Adjusted Glucagon
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose; 0.08, 0.17, 0.25, 0.33, 0.5, 0.67, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5 and 3.0 hours after glucagon administration

secondary_outcome.measure: PK: Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of Baseline Adjusted Glucagon
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose; 0.08, 0.17, 0.25, 0.33, 0.5, 0.67, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5 and 3.0 hours after glucagon administration

secondary_outcome.measure: PK: Maximum Change From Baseline Concentration (Cmax) of Glucagon
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose; 0.08, 0.17, 0.25, 0.33, 0.5, 0.67, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5 and 3.0 hours after glucagon administration

secondary_outcome.measure: Pharmacodynamics (PD): Area Under the Effect Concentration Time Curve (AUEC0-3) of Baseline-Adjusted Glucose From Time Zero up to 3 Hours
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose; 0.08, 0.17, 0.25, 0.33, 0.5, 0.67, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5 and 3.0 hours after glucagon administration

secondary_outcome.measure: PD: Time to Maximum Concentration (Tmax) of Baseline-Adjusted Glucose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose; 0.08, 0.17, 0.25, 0.33, 0.5, 0.67, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5 and 3.0 hours after glucagon administration

secondary_outcome.measure: PD: Baseline-Adjusted Glucose Maximum Concentration (BGmax) of Baseline-Adjusted Glucose
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Pre-dose; 0.08, 0.17, 0.25, 0.33, 0.5, 0.67, 1.0, 1.5, 2.0, 2.5 and 3.0 hours after glucagon administration

arm_group.description: Cohort 1 - Nasal Glucagon (NG) administered once in participants with a common cold.
Cohort 1 - NG administered once in participants who have recovered from a common cold.
Cohort 2 - NG administered once in participants with a common cold who are taking oxymetazoline.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Male or female participant presenting a score of 2 or 3 on nasal congestion and/or nasal discharge associated with at least one other symptom of common cold, as determined by the 8-item Jackson cold scale at screening and prior to dosing of period 1.
- Participant with a body mass index (BMI) greater than or equal to 18.50 and below 30.00 kilogram per square meter (kg/mÂ²).
- Light-, non- or ex-smokers.
- Have no clinically significant diseases captured in the medical history or evidence of clinically significant findings on physical examination and/or clinical laboratory evaluations (hematology, biochemistry, electrocardiogram [ECG] and urinalysis).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Presence of any nose piercings.
- History of significant hypersensitivity to glucagon, oxymetazoline or any related products (including excipients of the formulations) as well as severe hypersensitivity reactions (like angioedema) to any drugs.
- Presence of significant gastrointestinal, liver or kidney disease, or any other conditions known to interfere with the absorption, distribution, metabolism or excretion of drugs or known to potentiate or predispose to undesired effects.
- Presence of significant cardiovascular, pulmonary, hematologic, neurological, psychiatric, endocrine, immunologic or dermatologic disease.
- Presence of severe fever (more than 39.5 degrees Celsius) at screening or prior to dosing of period 1.
- Presence of clinically significant findings on nasal examination or bilateral anterior rhinoscopy, such as structural abnormalities, nasal polyps, marked septal deviation, nasal tumors.
- Presence or history of Type 1 or Type 2 diabetes.
- Presence or history of significant hypoglycemia or hyperglycemia.
- Use of beta-blockers, indomethacin, warfarin or anticholinergic drugs in the previous 28 days before day 1 of the study.
- Fasting blood glucose above 6.1 mmol/L at screening, following a 12-hour fasting period.
- Fasting blood glucose assessed with a glucose meter above 6.1 mmol/L approximately 0.5 hour before each dosing.

overall_official.last_name: Call 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559) or 1-317-615-4559 Mon - Fri 9 AM - 5 PM Eastern time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST)

facility.name: For additional information regarding investigative sites for this trial, contact 1-877-CTLILLY (1-877-285-4559, 1-317-615-4559) Mon - Fri from 9 AM to 5 PM Eastern Time (UTC/GMT - 5 hours, EST), or speak with your personal physician.

group.title: Nasal Glucagon (NG) 3 mg (Milligram)
group.description: Period 1: NG administered once in participants with a common cold. Period 2: NG administered once in participants who have recovered from a common cold.

group.title: NG 3 mg Plus Oxymetazoline
group.description: Period 1 only: NG administered once to participants with a common cold, who are taking oxymetazoline.

participants_list.participants: Cohort 2 only administered NG to participants with a common cold who are taking oxymetazoline.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is more than 60 days but less than or equal to 180 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.
